contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|Archer|archer}} An '''archer''' is a person who uses a bow and arrow, a practitioner of [[archery]]. It may also refer to: {{TOC right}} == People == * [[Archer (surname)]] == Fictional == * [[Cate Archer]], the main character in ''No One Lives Forever'', a computer game === Film and TV === * ''Archer'', a 1975 NBC television series starring [[Brian Keith]] * [[Archer (TV series)|''Archer'' (TV series)]], animated comedy series * [[The Archer (film)|''The Archer'' (film)]] * [[Jonathan Archer]], in the television show ''Star Trek: Enterprise'' * Nancy Archer, title character of the film ''[[Attack of the 50 Foot Woman]]'' * [[Sean Archer]], a character portrayed by John Travolta/Nicolas Cage in the movie ''Face/Off'' * [[State Military characters of the Fullmetal Alchemist anime#Frank Archer|Frank Archer]], a soldier in the ''Fullmetal Alchemist'' anime === Books === * [[Archer (comics)]], an ''X-Factor'' character in Marvel Comics * [[Archer (DC Comics)]], a fictional character * [[Lew Archer]], a private detective in series of novels by Ross MacDonald * [[Archer (Fate/stay night)]], a character in Fate/stay night media * [[Newland Archer]], a character in Edith Wharton's 1920 novel, ''The Age of Innocence'' * Several related characters in the Philip K. Dick novel ''[[The Transmigration of Timothy Archer]]'' == Places == ;Australia * [[Archer River]] in Cape York Peninsula ;United States * [[Archer, Florida]] * [[Archer, Iowa]] * [[Archer, Nebraska]] *[[Archer, West Virginia]] * [[Archer County, Texas]] == Military == * [[Archer (tank destroyer)]], the British tank destroyer * [[HMAS Archer|HMAS ''Archer'']], name of a ship of the Royal Australian Navy * [[HMS Archer|HMS ''Archer'']], name of seven ships of the Royal Navy * [[AA-11 Archer]], NATO reporting name of the Vympel R-73 air-to-air missile * [[Operation Archer]], Canadian Forces operation supporting Operation Enduring Freedom in Afghanistan * [[Archer Artillery System]], a partnership to develop a self-propelled artillery system for Sweden and Norway == Transportation == * [[Piper Archer]], a variant of the Piper Aircraft Cherokee general aviation airplane * {{MV|Archer}}, an American ship * [[Archer (automobile)]], a British cyclecar == Sports == * [[Archer Grand Prix cycle race]], an international cycle race held annually in Britain for over 50 years * [[Archer Road Club]], a London-based cycling club * [[Archer (horse)]], an Australian racehorse that won the first two Melbourne Cups in 1861 and 1862 == Other uses == * "The Archer", another name for the constellation [[Sagittarius (constellation)|Sagittarius]] * [[Airborne Real-time Cueing Hyperspectral Enhanced Reconnaissance]], an aerial imaging system * [[Archer (typeface)]] * [[ Archer (character class)]] == See also == * {{Lookfrom|Archer}} * [[Archers (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
